itemDescription: Crop rotation is the practice of growing different types of crops in the same area in sequential seasons. It helps improve soil health, reduce pests and diseases, and increase crop yield.
Pest management involves techniques to control and eliminate harmful pests in crops. Methods include biological control, chemical pesticides, and integrated pest management (IPM) strategies.
Efficient irrigation practices are crucial for maintaining soil moisture and ensuring healthy crop growth. Techniques include drip irrigation, sprinkler systems, and surface irrigation.
Maintaining soil fertility involves adding organic matter, using fertilizers, and practicing crop rotation to ensure the soil remains productive and capable of supporting healthy crops.
Proper harvesting techniques are essential for maximizing crop yield and quality. This includes knowing the right time to harvest and using appropriate tools and methods.
